byline.contributor: Choe Sang-Hun contributed reporting from Seoul, South Korea, and Patrick Boehler from Hong Kong.
byline.original: By EDWARD WONG and OWEN GUO

abstract: North Korean pop group Moranbong Band, favorite group of nation's leader Kim Jong-un, will perform at National Center for the Performing Arts in Beijing for their first overseas show; group is visiting as China and North Korea are attempting to improve relations.
lead_paragraph: The all-female Moranbong Band, Kim Jong-un’s favorite group, is visiting Beijing at a time when China and North Korea are trying to strengthen ties.

headline.main: North Korea Sends Its Leader’s Chosen Pop Band to Beijing
headline.print_headline: North Korea Sends Its Leader’s Chosen Pop Band to China

snippet: The all-female Moranbong Band, Kim Jong-un’s favorite group, is visiting Beijing at a time when China and North Korea are trying to strengthen ties.
